data.description:
Unlock is a protocol developers, creators, and platforms can use to create memberships. Unlock‚Äôs goal is to ease implementation and increase conversion from ‚Äúusers‚Äù to ‚Äúmembers,‚Äù creating a much healthier monetization environment for the web.

In short, Unlock is an open-source, collectively owned, community-governed, peer-to-peer system that creates time-based memberships.

Our goal is for Unlock to support multiple kinds of memberships, enable easy integration of these memberships into any application, and share the protocol‚Äôs ownership with its adopters.

**At its core, Unlock Protocol supports three main functions: minting, gating, and earning.**

**Mint:** Create a membership NFT
Memberships can be created via the minting process into two ways:

NFTs can be purchased by users. Users can purchase an NFT membership for themselves or others. These memberships may be purchased once or renewed on a recurring basis.
NFTs can be earned. The "manager" of a membership contract can airdrop or grant memberships to users at their discretion.
Once minted, members and managers can extend, cancel, terminate, or even "destroy" a membership.

Since these memberships are represented as NFTs, managers and members can define the metadata of the NFT itself. An NFT‚Äôs public metadata ‚Äî for instance, the image associated with a particular token or collection ‚Äî can be updated, changing the NFT‚Äôs associated artwork or visual representation. Similarly, an NFT‚Äôs private metadata (e.g. member information, Dapp data, or references to associated assets) can also be updated after minting.

**Gate:** Members-only access to perks, benefits, and resources
The core protocol includes functions to quickly identify a user's membership status. These functions can immediately determine if someone's membership is currently valid or if it has expired. This makes it trivial for an application to alter behavior (for example, token gating content or features) based on membership level or status.

Additionally, the protocol implements "hooks," enabling the option to delegate these membership checks to third-party contracts. This supports use cases of checking for membership based on a wallet holding arbitrary ERC-721, ERC-1155, or ERC-20 tokens from third-party collections.

**Earn:** Unlock Protocol is collectively owned by its members
The core protocol aims to be collectively owned and managed by its adopters, embracing a core web3 ethos.

Anyone who implements the protocol in their application can earn UDT governance tokens to join the Unlock DAO, or may elect to pass those earned governance tokens onto their community members as additional rewards.

UDT owners can submit and vote on protocol upgrades and the allocation of the treasury's funds.
data.title: Unlock Protocol

data.description:
Unlock Labs is the core team that created Unlock Protocol, the onchain, open-source protocol for memberships and subscriptions.

Unlock Labs has created a number of applications on top of Unlock Protocol that natively support and promote ENS. These applications are:

EVENTS by Unlock Labs: An onchain application for creating and managing onchain event ticketing, promotion, and registrations.

https://app.unlock-protocol.com/event

SUBSCRIPTIONS by Unlock Labs: An application the empowers creators to create and manage recurring subscriptions onchain.

https://app.unlock-protocol.com/subscription

CERTIFICATIONS by Unlock Labs: An application for issuing onchain certifcations.

https://app.unlock-protocol.com/certification 

Unlock Labs Dashboard: An overarching control center for deploying and managing smart contracts for memberships and subscriptions.

https://app.unlock-protocol.com 

All Unlock Labs applications natively support ENS resolution for users when they are creating or managing the memberships of their community. Additionally, individuals who are interacting with Unlock Labs apps such as EVENTS and SUBSCRIPTIONS can register for events and sign up for subscriptions using their ENS name.

Unlock Labs has been used by hundreds of projects to create hundreds of thousands of onchain tickets, memberships, and subscriptions since the project was launched in 2018. 

A subset of these projects can be viewed at https://showcase.unlock-protocol.com .
data.title: Unlock Labs Apps
ReFi DAO | Unlocking a Global Regen CoordiNATION
data.description:
ReFi DAO is a network society on a mission to regenerate the earth. ‚ú® üå±

ReFi DAO is at the forefront of the Regenerative Finance (ReFi) movement, a pioneering force dedicated to leveraging Web3 technologies to regenerate the Earth‚Äôs ecosystems and foster economic systems that prioritize ecological and social well-being.


ReFi DAO emerged as a founder-led startup community during the rapid influx of talent & capital that emerged in the 2021 ReFi boom. Since then, and thanks to the support of our community, we have become the cultural home of ReFi for top founders, investors and builders at the intersection of impact and web3. We are here to support the mycelial growth of regenerative culture, technology and ventures, both online and in-person. So far, we‚Äôve enabled more than 75 events in 58 cities, reached over 80k+ listeners, and served over 300 entrepreneurs. You can see the full list of founders, investors and events, content and deals on our website: refidao.com




Now, since the beginning of 2023, we have been laying the foundations for the emergence of a network of regenerative local communities across the globe. We refer to these as ‚ÄòReFi Local Nodes‚Äô.


What are ReFi Local Nodes? üó∫

Connected by an online community, and enabled by the most powerful tools of our time‚ÄîLocal Nodes bring the physical and digital world together into a symphony of inner and outer regeneration. They are for founders conducting radical experiments to unlock a regenerative economy at scale, they‚Äôre for leaders of public, private and third-sector institutions, and they‚Äôre for anyone committed to taking action, building community, and making the world a better place.



One node at a time, we aim to create an interconnected, self-sustaining world, where technology and humanity walk hand in hand towards regeneration. You can browse through the list of existing Local Nodes at refidao.com/community/local. For an overview of the impact created by the local Node Network in 2023, check out this post: Regenerative Journeys: ReFi Local Nodes 2023 Roundup.



Regen CoordiNATION üå±

CoordiNATIONs are interwoven networks of community driven by shared values, mutualism, and voluntary association. At the heart of ReFi DAO‚Äôs vision lies a commitment towards forming a ‚ÄòRegen CoordiNATION‚Äô weaving deeper partnership and interconnection between GreenPill Network, Regens Unite, Crypto Commons Association, and other value-aligned partners. Through collaborations on guides, toolkits, grant pools, guilds and more, we seek to unlock positive-sum synergies and build a pluralistic regenerative society for all.



The Future is Regenerative. Come Join! ‚ú®

As we stand on the precipice of a new era, ReFi DAO, along with its committed partners and communities, seeks to be the catalyst for change. The notion of a global regenerative economy is no longer a distant dream; it's a tangible vision that we can collectively achieve. With every local node we establish, every piece of knowledge we share, and every collaboration we embark on, we inch closer to a sustainable, interconnected future. This is not just our mission‚Äîit's an invitation. Join us. Be a part of the Regen CoordiNATION. Together, let's reimagine the future üåøüåéüå±


By donating to this grant you can directly support the creation of local regenerative economies at a global scale. Any donations would be hugely appreciated!

data.title: GG22 OSS - Developer Tooling and Libraries

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
Provide a brief overview of your tool, library, or framework. What specific problem or inefficiency in the development process does it address?
questions.explanation:
# Unlock Tools and Libraries

Unlock Protocol is an open-source protocol governed by Unlock DAO, an assembly of UP token holders (former UDT) and active community participants who have been rewarded with the native ecosystem token.
Since its founding, the protocol and especially the Unlock Labs team, with support from Unlock DAO, has developed a range of open-source smart contracts verified on Etherscan. Unlock Protocol utilizes [Ethers](https://docs.ethers.io/), a popular Ethereum library written in JavaScript. It offers a straightforward way for developers to integrate our Ethereum smart contracts into their applications. 

Unlock offers several options for developers to gain easy access to these smart contracts and implement them into their native applications for various use cases. Uses can include but are not limited to: onchain events, memberships, subscriptions, and certifications.

questions.query: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.
questions.explanation:
# Actively Reducing Development Barriers

Our tools include support and tooling for front-end as well as back-end development. These different access points generate a more intuitive learning curve. As the builders' abilities grow more confident, they can also opt into more complex ways of utilizing the protocol. Here are some examples:

## Front-End
- [Embedding locks (our name for Unlock smart contracts) to websites as a paywall](https://docs.unlock-protocol.com/tutorials/front-end/locking-page)
- [A Starter Kit to enable working with React and Unlock Protocol](https://docs.unlock-protocol.com/tutorials/front-end/react-example)
- [A learning suit for Unlock Protocol developer noobs with Scaffold-eth](https://docs.unlock-protocol.com/tutorials/front-end/scaffold-eth)

## Back-End
- [Token-gating with Express.js](https://docs.unlock-protocol.com/tutorials/back-end/backend-locking-with-express.js)
- [Webhooks with the Locksmith API](https://docs.unlock-protocol.com/tutorials/back-end/locksmith-webhooks)


As you can see in the following link, all our tools have additional written and often video tutorial companies to give an easy start to new developers: 

- **Tools and Libraries:** https://docs.unlock-protocol.com/tools/ 
- **Builder Tutorials:** https://docs.unlock-protocol.com/tutorials/

questions.query: Describe the current usage and support for your tool within the developer community. This could include GitHub stars, downloads, or testimonials from developers.
questions.explanation:
# Current Usage and Support

Several projects have utilized our range of smart contracts for their specific applications. To name a few:

- EVENT TICKETING: [DappCon](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nK0i5ub0CTY) (PS: We also supported DappCon24)
- MEMBERSHIPS: [Web3 Academy](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/kazm-integrates-unlock-protocol-to-enable-fully-managed-on-chain-memberships-for-web3-academy-301795216.html)
- EVENT TICKETING: [EthCC 2022](https://unlock-protocol.com/blog/ethcc5-2022-ticketing?_gl=1*13n72u4*_ga*MTk3MTk5MTMwNi4xNjk4MjI1Njk0*_ga_DGDLJTEV6N*MTcyOTc2MDcyMy4xMC4xLjE3Mjk3NjI4OTguMC4wLjA.)
- CERTIFICATIONS: [CDAA](https://unlock-protocol.com/blog/cdaa-unlock-case-study?_gl=1*hd5rst*_ga*MTk3MTk5MTMwNi4xNjk4MjI1Njk0*_ga_DGDLJTEV6N*MTcyOTc2MDcyMy4xMC4xLjE3Mjk3NjI5OTAuMC4wLjA.)

Beyond these more prominent use cases, we regularly share general use cases that we deem as important as the bigger ones on our [Showcase page](https://showcase.unlock-protocol.com/). We invite you to explore the diversity of projects utilizing Unlock Protocol smart contracts in various ways fitting their specific community needs.

Beyond the above, Unlock Labs, as well as Unlock DAO Members, have taken great initiative to drive native integrations with fellow open-source applications,
such as:

- [HatsProtocol](https://www.hatsprotocol.xyz/wearer/access) 
- [Darkblock.io](https://www.darkblock.io/news/unlock-subscriptions/)

To review the general growth of our community and the usage of the protocol from individuals to developers, please review our Unlock Dashboard created by Unlock Labs Team member Christopher Carfi: [The State of Unlock](https://unlock-protocol.com/state)

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation:
# Grant Roadmap

If Unlock DAO were to receive this grant we are intending to put it forth into developing further infrastructure connections. What we have agreed upon so far:

- Generate more educational materials for developers about using the protocol on different chains (some materials are outdated or have not been created yet for freshly added chains).
- Create a more structured and comprehensive resource library, especially regarding recommended UI/ UX examples.
- Generate more community-built use cases as go-to examples. We have realized that, even for developers, it is hard to imagine how to build upon the protocol. Not because it is complicated but because it feels overwhelming, as if you could do everything with it! We intend to give them more packaged ideas in the future, which will help with orientation.

On a side note, the Unlock Labs team will continue building, innovating, and creating even more publicly available resources. We actively promote bounties around the protocol and look forward to building more!

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

questions.query: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
Unlock Protocol contributes in three distinct ways:

- The protocol is entirely open-source and ready to fork and embed. All of the Unlock smart contracts are therefore open-source as well as fully audited and, beyond that, verified on Etherscan. The latter means developers can easily retrieve the contract's ABI directly from Etherscan or use our @unlock-protocol/contracts package. To gain a very complete overview, please review the [Unlock Protocol Litepaper](https://docs.unlock-protocol.com/getting-started/what-is-unlock/litepaper/).
- Additionally, Unlock is an EVM multi-chain (14 networks) protocol that supports the growth of communities beyond one chain. Users can remain in the ecosystem they chose for their project/ community and still utilize the protocol.
- Our ethical standards are driven by the DAO that governs the protocol. Unlock DAO is a growing and committed community that is loyal to the protocol and what it stands for (including the open-source standard). Since last year, the community has grown due to some internal changes and has started to flourish along these new implementations.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
Unlock Protocol is a permissionless and peer-governed protocol that allows creators, developers, and community organizers to deploy no-code smart contracts onchain for ticketing, recurring subscriptions, certifications, and memberships. 

Several communities, individual creators, and developers have used Unlock to publish their own work or events onchain. The [Unlock Showcase](https://showcase.unlock-protocol.com/) page offers a good overview of some specific use cases relying on the abovementioned features.

What sets Unlock Protocol apart, aside from being multi-chain, peer-governed, and open-source, is that it is easy to use and features a seamless user interface. This makes the protocol and its sub-applications (Unlock Events & Unlock Certifications) very inclusive tool kits in the Web3 space.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: As mentioned above, the DAO has been growing since last year and started to attract more attention. We want to keep these energies going and provide micro-grants to active and engaged community members so they can start building up more business-oriented models on top of the protocol owned by the DAO. This initiative, led by the current Council of Stewards at Unlock Protocol DAO, aims to make the DAO self-sustainable in the long term without charging heavy protocol fees.
